jparsec.vo

Class SExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.vo.SExtractor

  • public class SExtractor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to run SExtractor to extract sources from images. In the execution the adequate file default.param is created. Another required file is the machine.config, that can be created with createMachineConfigFile(String, double, double, double, double, double, int, int). Note that in the output positions for the stars from SExtractor the center of the first pixel of the image is at (1, 1), not (0, 0).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String file)
             throws JPARSECException
        Process a given .fits file. The method will accept a jpg/png image and will convert it to fits before starting, using the green channel.
        Parameters:
        file - Name of/path to the .fits file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • removeTemporalFiles

        public void removeTemporalFiles(boolean alsoConfig)
        Removes the temporal files machine.config (optionally), default.param, default.nnw, and coord.cat from the working directory.
        Parameters:
        alsoConfig - True to remove also the configuration file.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a list of sources detected. Starting from third line a table with x position, y, size w x h (pixels), flux, and class is given, including errors.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int ndec)
        Returns a list of sources detected.
        Parameters:
        ndec - Number of decimal places for the numerical values, without considering the significant digits based on the errors of the different parameters as in the toString() method.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the results of the source extraction.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int ndec,
                        double minArea)
        Returns a list of sources detected.
        Parameters:
        ndec - Number of decimal places for the numerical values, without considering the significant digits based on the errors of the different parameters as in the toString() method.
        minArea - Minimum area of the star/object in pixels to consider it as detected. Note this is the same as the input parameter to create the machine.config file, but it is allowed here also since sometimes SExtractor returns sources below the provided minimum area.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the results of the source extraction.

      • createMachineConfigFile

        public static void createMachineConfigFile(java.lang.String path,
                           double saturation,
                           double gain,
                           double pixScale,
                           double seeing,
                           double mag0,
                           int minArea,
                           int sigma)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Creates a compatible machine.config file in a given directory to use it with SExtractor. There are certain relations between the gain and the magnitude 0 point: 
         Image type         Gain       Magnitude-0
 -----------------------------------------
 
 shot in counts/s   gain*texp  mag0 for 1s exposure (constant value) = mag0(1s)
 One shot (counts)  gain       mag0 for that (total) texp = mag0(1s) + 2.5 log10 (texp)
 Sum of N frames    gain       mag0(1s) + 2.5 log10 (total texp)
 Average N frames   gain*N     mag0(1s) + 2.5 log10 (averaged texp)
 Median of N frames 2*gain*N/3 mag0(1s) + 2.5 log10 (averaged texp)
        Another table with useful info about some detectors: 
         Detector           Saturation Gain (400 ISO)
 --------------------------------------------
 
 40D                12900      0.84 (Gain at ISO x = (400/x) * Gain400)
 50D                8700       0.57
 5D                 15800      3.99
 5D Mark II         15500      1.01
 1D Mark III                   1.2
 QSI 532            85000      1.31
 Nikon D200                    2.0
 Nikon D70                     2.98
 Nikon D50                     3.72
 Nikon D3                      2.1
 Nikon D300                    0.67
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the directory where machine.config will be created.
        saturation - Saturation level in ADUs. For instance 16386 = 2^14 for a 14 bit detector, although saturation always occurs before that level.
        gain - Detector gain in e-/ADU. Can be set to 12288/2^14 for a 14 bit detector and ISO 400.
        pixScale - The pixel size in arcseconds per pixel. Set to 0 to obtain it from the WCS data in the fits file.
        seeing - The seeing in arcseconds.
        mag0 - The magnitude 0 point for photometry. Depends on instrument, filter, and camera. In case of an image with total counts for a given time in seconds (texp) you should add to that value the result of 2.5 log10 (texp).
        minArea - The minimum number of pixels above sigma to consider a source as detected. Set it between 3 and 10 depending on how sensitive you want the source detection algorithm to be.
        sigma - How much times the pixels should be above the background emission to consider a source as detected. Set it between 5 and 10.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • crossMatch

        public int[] crossMatch(SExtractor sex,
               double maxError,
               boolean sameImageOrientationAndField,
               int nsources)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Performs a cross match of the sources in this instance with the sources in another instance.
        Parameters:
        sex - The second SExtractor instance with their sources also solved.
        maxError - The maximum error in pixels as a tolerance for the cross matching, for instance 0.5.
        sameImageOrientationAndField - True in case the solved sources corresponds to images with the same field and orientation, so that a simple and fast cross match can be performed, false otherwise.
        nsources - The number of sources to use for the cross matching. Set to 0 or negative to take all of them, or any other value equal or greater than 4 for the brightest n sources. Other values will launch an exception in case the images are not taken in the exactly same field and orientation.
        Returns:
        Value returned is null in case the sources are not solved in one of the instances or the number of sources is 0. Otherwise, an integer array is returned so that its first value gives the index in the second instance (provided in the call to this method) of the first source in this instance.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • crossMatchOneSource

        public int crossMatchOneSource(SExtractor sex,
                      double maxError,
                      int index)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Performs a cross match of one source in this instance with the sources in another instance. The images solved in both instances must correspond to the same field of view and orientation.
        Parameters:
        sex - The second SExtractor instance with their sources also solved.
        maxError - The maximum error in pixels as a tolerance for the cross matching, for instance 0.5.
        index - The index of the source to cross match in this instance.
        Returns:
        Value returned is -1 in case the source is not identified. Otherwise the index of that source in the other instance provided in this call is returned.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getSourcesAsTable

        public Table getSourcesAsTable()
        Returns all the sources solved as a Table object in 2d. The table contains the following columns: x positions, y positions, widths, heights, fluxes, classes, magnitudes, detection widths, detection heights.
        Returns:
        The Table object.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.
